t: Deuteronomy 32
“Give*pn ear, O heavens, and I will speak; And*ld hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
Let*ld my teaching drop as the rain, My*ld speech distill as the dew, As*ld raindrops on the tender herb, And*ld as showers on the grass.
For*ld I proclaim the name of the Lord:*s Ascribe*ld greatness to our God.
He*ild is*i the Rock, His work is*i perfect; For*ld all His ways are*i justice, A*ld God of truth and without injustice; Righteous*ld and upright is*i He.
“They*ld have corrupted themselves; They*ild are*i not His children, Because*ld of their blemish: A*ld perverse and crooked generation.
Do*ld you thus deal with the Lord,*s O*ld foolish and unwise people? Is*ild He not your Father, who*i bought you? Has*ld He not made you and established you?
“Remember*ln the days of old, Consider*ld the years of many generations. Ask*ld your father, and he will show you; Your*ld elders, and they will tell you:
When*ld the Most High divided their inheritance to the nations, When*ld He separated the sons of Adam, He*ld set the boundaries of the peoples According*ld to the number of the children of Israel.
For*ld the Lord’s*s portion is*i His people; Jacob*ld is*i the place of His inheritance.
“He*ln found him in a desert land And*ld in the wasteland, a howling wilderness; He*ld encircled him, He instructed him, He*ld kept him as the apple of His eye.
As*ld an eagle stirs up its nest, Hovers*ld over its young, Spreading*ld out its wings, taking them up, Carrying*ld them on its wings,
So*ild the Lord*s alone led him, And*ld there*i was*i no foreign god with him.
“He*ln made him ride in the heights of the earth, That*ld he might eat the produce of the fields; He*ld made him draw honey from the rock, And*ld oil from the flinty rock;
Curds*ld from the cattle, and milk of the flock, With*ld fat of lambs; And*ld rams of the breed of Bashan, and goats, With*ld the choicest wheat; And*ld you drank wine, the blood of the grapes.
“But*ln Jeshurun grew fat and kicked; You*ld grew fat, you grew thick, You*ld are obese! Then*ld he forsook God who*i made him, And*ld scornfully esteemed the Rock of his salvation.
They*ld provoked Him to jealousy with foreign gods;*i With*ld abominations they provoked Him to anger.
They*ld sacrificed to demons, not to God, To*ild gods*i they did not know, To*ld new gods,*i new arrivals That*ld your fathers did not fear.
Of*ld the Rock who*i begot you, you are unmindful, And*ld have forgotten the God who fathered you.
“And*ln when the Lord*s saw it,*i He spurned them,*i Because*ld of the provocation of His sons and His daughters.
And*ld He said: ‘I will hide My face from them, I*ld will see what their end will*i be,*i For*ld they are*i a perverse generation, Children*ld in whom is*i no faith.

They*ld have provoked Me to jealousy by what*i is not God; They*ld have moved Me to anger by their foolish idols. But*ld I will provoke them to jealousy by those*i who*i are*i not a nation; I*ld will move them to anger by a foolish nation.
For*ld a fire is kindled in My anger, And*ld shall burn to the lowest hell; It*ld shall consume the earth with her increase, And*ld set on fire the foundations of the mountains.
‘I*ln will heap disasters on them; I*ld will spend My arrows on them.
They*ild shall*i be*i wasted with hunger, Devoured*ld by pestilence and bitter destruction; I*ld will also send against them the teeth of beasts, With*ld the poison of serpents of the dust.
The*ld sword shall destroy outside; There*ild shall*i be*i terror within For*ld the young man and virgin, The*ld nursing child with the man of gray hairs.
I*ld would have said, “I will dash them in pieces, I*ld will make the memory of them to cease from among men,”
Had*ld I not feared the wrath of the enemy, Lest*ld their adversaries should misunderstand, Lest*ld they should say, “Our hand is*i high; And*ld it is not the Lord*s who has done all this.”’
“For*ln they are*i a nation void of counsel, Nor*ld is*i there*i any*i understanding in them.
Oh,*ld that they were wise, that*i they understood this, That*ild they would consider their latter end!
How*ld could one chase a thousand, And*ld two put ten thousand to flight, Unless*ld their Rock had sold them, And*ld the Lord*s had surrendered them?
For*ld their rock is*i not like our Rock, Even*ld our enemies themselves being*i judges.
For*ld their vine is*i of the vine of Sodom And*ld of the fields of Gomorrah; Their*ld grapes are*i grapes of gall, Their*ld clusters are*i bitter.
Their*ld wine is*i the poison of serpents, And*ld the cruel venom of cobras.
‘Is*iln this not laid up in store with Me, Sealed*ld up among My treasures?
Vengeance*ld is Mine, and recompense; Their*ld foot shall slip in due*i time; For*ld the day of their calamity is*i at hand, And*ld the things to come hasten upon them.’
“For*ln the Lord*s will judge His people And*ld have compassion on His servants, When*ld He sees that their*i power is gone, And*ld there*i is*i no one remaining,*i bond or free.
He*ld will say: ‘Where are*i their gods, The*ld rock in which they sought refuge?
Who*ld ate the fat of their sacrifices, And*ild drank the wine of their drink offering? Let*ld them rise and help you, And*ild be your refuge.
‘Now*ln see that I, even*i I, am*i He, And*ld there*i is*i no God besides Me; I*ld kill and I make alive; I*ld wound and I heal; Nor*ld is*i there*i any*i who can deliver from My hand.
For*ld I raise My hand to heaven, And*ld say, “As*i I live forever,
If*ld I whet My glittering sword, And*ld My hand takes hold on judgment, I*ld will render vengeance to My enemies, And*ld repay those who hate Me.
I*ld will make My arrows drunk with blood, And*ld My sword shall devour flesh, With*ld the blood of the slain and the captives, From*ld the heads of the leaders of the enemy.”’
“Rejoice,*ln O Gentiles, with*i His people; For*ld He will avenge the blood of His servants, And*ld render vengeance to His adversaries; He*ld will provide atonement for His land and*i His people.”
So*p Moses came with Joshua the son of Nun and spoke all the words of this song in the hearing of the people.
Moses finished speaking all these words to all Israel,
and he said to them: “Set your hearts on all the words which I testify among you today, which you shall command your children to be careful to observe—all the words of this law.
For it is*i not a futile thing for you, because it is*i your life, and by this word you shall prolong your*i days in the land which you cross over the Jordan to possess.”
Moses to Die on Mount Nebo
Then*p the Lord*s spoke to Moses that very same day, saying:
“Go up this mountain of the Abarim, Mount Nebo, which is*i in the land of Moab, across from Jericho; view the land of Canaan, which I give to the children of Israel as a possession;
and die on the mountain which you ascend, and be gathered to your people, just as Aaron your brother died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his people;
because you trespassed against Me among the children of Israel at the waters of Meribah Kadesh, in the Wilderness of Zin, because you did not hallow Me in the midst of the children of Israel.
Yet you shall see the land before you,*i though you shall not go there, into the land which I am giving to the children of Israel.”
